text:
hello guys any experience here having problem with using Deals API.. limit only is 100, is there any way how we can call more than 100 so my data will display perfectly :disappointed:

<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals?limit=100>
Hey guys, does anyone know how to create an hour-formatted property type?

Use pagination.  Using the limit and after parameters you can either show 100 per page (limit) with a next page button (after parameter) or in your controller code you could do the pagination programmatically in order to send all to you page.  But as your deals grow and you have thousands using paging controls on your page is probably better.

Hi everyone,

Do you know how can I add a button with some custom functionality for a page with objects enlisted?

Hey team,
is it possible in HubSpot to pull data using PUT request? In my case databricks will push data from S3 to HubSpot via put request, if it is feasible?

Also can we pull calls, emails, tasks, meetings, accounts which are present in salesforce into HubSpot?

method for each endpoint is available here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/overview>, if an enpoint is a GET, then you should call it with a GET request, if you want to use a PUT instead you probably need to implement some sort of middleware that handles your PUT request and then call the original GET request behind the scenes

Hi everyone,

I'm trying to update a contact through the API.
I'm making all my requests through an app I've created and connected to my client's HubSpot account.

I'm getting the error `This app hasn't been granted all required scopes to make this call.`. I've added a new scope to my app, `crm.objects.contacts.write`, but I'm still getting the error.

Should I reconnect the app to the HubSpot account? Is there a way to grant the app more permissions?

Thanks in advance for any advice!

It says in this interface "Required scopes must be listed in the `scope` query parameter of the install URL.".

Of course I did not have that scope at the time, so should I re-install the app or is there an easier way to grant the new scope after installing? (I hope so!)
you need to reinstall the app (and probably implement some sort of notification in your app that prompts the user to reinstall the app if that scope is missing)
Alright, thank you!
In my case it's really a bespoke, one-off app used only for this client, so no need to notify anyone. :slightly_smiling_face:

Hello folks.
Just a heads-up - I don’t know if this constitutes a bug, but we discovered yesterday that the Redirects tool will let you create infinite loops by redirecting a URL to itself. We managed to do this by accident in a mass-import. Raised with support, but I was surprised that there’s no validation to stop that happening.
may i ask how you discovered it?
you can’t

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:

• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.
Thank you

I need to pass as a variable instead don't I? Something like this:

<script>
  var myTimezone = "{{ module.timzone }}";
</script>
awesome! Thank you

While uploading mass redirects.

The redirects file (supplied by the client) mistakenly assumed that old domain to new domain needed to be in there (which it didn’t - because a HubSpot domain redirect was in place). So, old domain got updated to the new domain, and that left us with a row with an identical source and destination.

How did we know? The website (well, the homepage at least) basically went down.

I also tested again on a developer sandbox. Same redirect loop.
Thanks for sharing

Lastly,  I am trying to pull deals by pipeline with this ID "8244623"

I tried to run the api link this way "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals?limit=100&pipeline=8244623>"

I only want to show deals under the pipeline id only sir.  That link above doesnt work it still pull deals from other pipelines
Cant help with pages but our Schema replicator can migrate alot of Objects. <https://datawarehouse.io/product/HubSpot-to-HubSpot-schema-replicator/> and its free.
